# Welcome {.unnumbered}

## Overview of the Countdown to 2030 {.unnumbered}

The Countdown to 2030 for Women’s, Children’s and Adolescents’ Health (The Countdown) initiative is a global collaboration involving academics from national, regional, and international institutions, UN agencies, the World Bank, and civil society organizations. The initiative tracks progress in Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn, Child, and Adolescent Health and Nutrition (RMNCAH+N), fostering advocacy and accountability through rigorous data analysis.

**Key objectives include:**

-   Strengthening country-led data analysis and monitoring
-   Fostering innovation and evidence generation through multi-country collaboration
-   Enhancing global measurement and monitoring Improving policy and program communication

For more on Countdown to 2030 initiative, visit: [The Countdown website](https://www.countdown2030.org/about)

## About the `cd2030.extractor` R Package {.unnumbered}

The `cd2030.extractor` R Shiny app is designed to help users download Countdown data directly from DHIS2.  
It works with DHIS2 instances across all supported countries.

The app is hosted on GitHub:  
[https://github.com/aphrcwaro/extractor_guide](https://github.com/aphrcwaro/extractor_guide)

Full documentation is available here:  
[https://aphrcwaro.github.io/extractor_guide/](https://aphrcwaro.github.io/extractor_guide/)

### Key Features

- Intuitive interface for selecting and managing data  
- Direct integration with DHIS2 for streamlined access  
- Outputs data in the Countdown-standard format for analysis and reporting
